content:
Certainly! Here are some books and articles that may be of interest:

Books:
- "The Resurrection of Mary Magdalene: Legends, Apocrypha, and the Christian Testament" by Jane Schaberg
- "Mary Magdalene and the Drama of Saints: Theater, Gender, and Religion in Late Medieval England" by Theresa Coletti
- "Mary Magdalene Revealed: The First Apostle, Her Feminist Gospel and the Christianity We Haven't Tried Yet" by Meggan Watterson
- "Re-imagining Mary Magdalene: A Feminist Reading of the Last Apostle" by Erin Roberts

Articles:
- "The Case Against Mary Magdalene" by Karen L. King (published in the Harvard Theological Review)
- "Mary Magdalene and the Discourse of Desire" by Elizabeth A. Castelli (published in the Journal of Feminist Studies in Religion)
- "Mary Magdalene as a Theological Muse for Today" by Beverly Roberts Gaventa (published in the Journal of Theological Interpretation)

I hope these recommendations are helpful!
